public interface zeta.format.Formattable

(source file: Formattable.java)
java.lang.Object
   |
   +----zeta.format.Formattable
The pure class interface. 
public interface Formattable
This interface, if implemented by a class, indicates that a custom method toFormat for formatting is provided. The method for building a format, Format.buildFormat, uses this method for formatting an object if it is provided.

The custom method takes as a parameter a data object which may be used to detect cycles and sharing in object structures.

Here is an example of an implementation of toFormat with sharing detection: 

  public Format toFormat(FormatInfo info){
    if (info.visited(this))
      // return just a label reference for this object
      return info.getLabel(this);
    else 
      return block(info.visitAndGetLabel(this),
                   Format.buildFormat(info, field1),
		   ...,
                   Format.buildFormat(info, fieldn));
  }

Author:
Jacob Wieland (ughosage@cs.tu-berlin.de)
Version: $Id: Formattable.java,v 1.1.1.1 1998/09/01 10:51:13 wg Exp $
See also:
buildFormat, FormatInfo

toFormat(FormatInfo)
Convert this object to a format.

toFormat
public abstract Format toFormat(FormatInfo info);
Convert this object to a format.

Parameters:
info - An information object of type FormatInfo containing information about the Format context of this object (like already visited objects to prevent recursions).
Returns:
A Format object to be used for pretty printing the contents of this object.
See also:
Format, FormatInfo
